main event: A blue-white-red-green missile was sighted in the North Atlantic on December 8, 1961.
interesting points: The lights were moving in a scattered formation, hovering, and pulsating., The observation lasted for 32 minutes., The object maintained a glide path and was observed on radar., The sighting was not seen by the pilot of the aircraft., The case was concluded as insufficient data, with a probable meteor explanation.
witness description: not sighted by the pilot, but radar confirmed the objects
